results.title: Graphic communication
results.creator_credit: Alexander Milsky and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A series of basic geometric shapes are used to illustrates how signs, symbols and diagrams can be employed to represent written or verbal information. Quite complex concepts can often be conveyed effectively by the use of simple symbols.

results.title: Being right: can you still lose?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Questions, Answers.”.
An excerpt from the feature ” Ride a wild pony”, which has an Australian setting. Conflict flares when two children claim ownership of a wild pony. A judge settles the dispute by allowing the pony to decide. The film centres on how the children cope with the decision. The aim of the film is to allow children to explore the concepts of winning and losing and how to deal with them. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: What about tomorrow?
results.creator_credit: Dave Smallin and A Dave Smallin Production
results.brief_description: The consumption of alcohol by adolescents is the subject of this dramatized open-ended film. The influences upon teenagers to take up drinking are indicated and one young man is confronted with the possible long term effects of alcohol misuse.

results.title: Ride On
results.creator_credit: John La Pointe and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A film on bicycle safety which begins with a comic history of the development of both the wheel and the bicycle. Six basic safety rules are stressed. Two points of difference beween Australia and Canada are that Australians ride on the left side of the road and the ‘yield’ sign is replaced by ‘give way’.

results.title: Picasso: war, peace & love
results.brief_description: From his epic “Guernica” to some of his last works. This film spans some thirty years of Picasso’s art. It includes many unfamiliar works as well as some unique live sequences of the artist in his studio near Cannes. NOTE: Film content is worthy of viewing but print condition is poor with excessive colour fade (pinkish-red tones).

results.title: Mice and how they live
results.brief_description: Cactus mice are used to indicate typical behaviour of mice, but this species is atypical in that it does not need to drink. Close-up photography is used to reveal habitat, food, physical description and behaviour of mice. English verion of German motion picture.

results.title: Frogs and how they live
results.brief_description: Uses close-up photography toreveal key concepts about this familiar amphibian. The process of metamorphosis, hibernation and details of major body parts are also shown. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Empirical formula by micro-analysis
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Shows procedures necessary to determine the empirical formula of a substance. Amounts of carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen are determined by estimating the weight of CO2, H2O and NH3 produced by the unknown. Students are expected to record the data and use it to ascertain the formula. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Two little frosts
results.brief_description: An animated story in the style of a folk tale in which man is pitted against the elements. The personified frost creatures assume that an old man will fall easily prey to their ability to freeze. Despite all their efforts, the experienced woodman unknowingly defeats the two little frosts.

results.title: Mouse-activated candle lighter
results.creator_credit: Prism Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: The mouse-activated candle lighter illustrates various forms of potential and kinetic energy. It is made from a mousetrap, fishing rod, alarm clock, ice-pack, train motor, rubberband, match and candle. Students are challenged to find the many forms of energy hidden in the mechanism and their movements. Suitable for secondary level.
